channel.title: Redash Scalability
channel.description: We are trying to scale redash horizontally . it would be great if some one let us know related to how exactly its possible including both pros and cons. Basically idea is to configure redash in 2 different server .Each server would be running redash worker in docker container in 2 different server and pointing to same metadata postgres server. Please let us know how to achieve it.

item.title: Redash Scalability
item.dc:creator: mudasirmirza
item.description:
Hi @deepakdas12 ,

I am also a beginner when it comes to redash, but I would say if you keep the REDASH_COOKIE_SECRET and REDASH_SECRET_KEY same in both instances, and point to the same postgres instance, it should work fine.
You would need to setup a load balancer in front of the instances and my suggestion would be to enable sticky session in the load balancer.

May be someone else can provide better answer.

Regards,
Mudasir Mirza.
